byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo, and Saeed Al-Batati from Al Mukalla, Yemen.

abstract: Arab states agree to form combined military force to counter both Iranian influence and Islamist extremism; analysts say agreement is due in large part to their desire for more independence from United States.
lead_paragraph: Many analysts attributed the move, intended to counter both Iranian influence and Islamist extremism, in large part to the Arab states’ drive for more independence from Washington.

headline.main: Arab Nations to Form Military Force to Counter Iran and Islamist Extremists
headline.print_headline: Arab Nations to Form Military Force to Counter Iran and Extremists

snippet: Many analysts attributed the move, intended to counter both Iranian influence and Islamist extremism, in large part to the Arab states’ drive for more independence from Washington.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
